text: Sydney Baldwin is an American ice hockey defender, currently playing for the Minnesota Whitecaps in the NWHL. == Career == In 2014, Baldwin was awarded the Minnesota Ms. Hockey Award.https://www.twincities.com/2019/01/25/the-25-greatest-players-to-play- minnesota-girls-high-school-hockey-nos-16-25/ Across 151 games with the University of Minnesota, Baldwin put up 81 points.https://gophersports.com/sports/womens-ice-hockey/roster/sydney- baldwin/10084https://www.twincities.com/2018/03/09/gophers-sydney-baldwin- takes-lumps-en-route-to-wcha-player-of-year-award/ In 2018, she was named a finalist for the Patty Kazmaier Memorial Award.https://www.thedailygopher.com/2018/3/16/17127954/minnesota-womens- hockey-gophers-sydney-baldwin-named-first-team-all-american-frozen-four- ridderhttp://fs.ncaa.org/Docs/stats/w_icehockey_rb/2020/Awards.pdf After graduating, she signed with EHV Sabres Wien of the European Women's Hockey League.https://gophersports.com/news/2018/5/9/Baldwin_Reilly_Sign_with_Vienna_Sabres.aspx?path=whockey Putting up 19 points in 10 games, she would be named to the EWHL All-Star Team.http://www.ehv-sabres.at/index.php/ewhl/902-sabres-verlieren-ewhl- finalehttps://www.startribune.com/whitecaps-sign-former-gophers-standout- sydney-baldwin/559261982/ On the 3rd of September 2019, Baldwin signed with the Minnesota Whitecaps of the NWHL.https://thehockeywriters.com/minnesota- whitecaps-sign-sydney-baldwin/ After scoring 18 points in 17 games in her rookie season, she was named to the 2020 NWHL All-Star Game, but couldn't participate.https://www.theicegarden.com/2020/3/30/21184683/the-unofficial- nwhl-all-rookie-team-putigna-cornine-vlasic-pelletier-baldwin-selander === International === Baldwin represented the US at the IIHF U18 Women's World Championships in 2013 and 2014, winning a silver medal both times.https://teamusa.usahockey.com/page/show/2875442-sydney-baldwin In 2014, she served as one of the team's assistant captains. == References == ==External links== * Biographical information and defensemen Category:Ice hockey people from Minnesota
title: Sydney Baldwin
